page.title: 04Rawmarsh Comprehensive
page.content: Rawmarsh Comprehensive School was completed on January 1, 1931, and was then called Rawmarsh New Council School. It became co-educational in 1963 and a comprehensive in 1974. It has seven 'feeder' schools, Monkwood, Rosehill, Ashwood, Sandhill, Thorogate, St.Joseph's and St.Mary's. There are{1,030}pupils on roll and {61}staff. The school will get smaller in the next five years but will then grow in numbers during the 1990s. One of the main developments in education is{'Curriculum Enquiry'}as schools look at what they teach and how subjects are taught. There is also to be a new examin- ation called the{G.C.S.E.}which will replace the G.C.E.'O' Level, the C.S.E. and the joint 16-plus examin- ations. The first courses will begin in September,1986.
